result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
BRANCH 01 FOR BRANCH 29
Defendant Kayla Marvella Avery in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Defendant Kayla Marvella Avery in custody.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Competency Hearing proceeded.  State does not challenge Dr. Collins report.  Defense does challenge Dr. Collins report.  Parties stipulated and qualified Dr. Collins to testify as an expert.  Sworn for the State:  Dr. Deborah Collins. Exhibit 1 received. Sworn for Defense: Kayla Avery. Testimony closed.  Arguments heard.

After review of all evidence, report of Dr. Collins, and testimony, Court finds defendant incompetent to proceed at this time but is likely to become competent.  Court ordered defendant commitment for treatment for incompetency.  Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the sheriffs department to arrange for transportation of the defendant to the treatment facility FORTHWITH.  
The defendant shall be given 82 days of credit for re commitment incarceration. Court ordered proceedings suspended. Case is adjourned to Br. 01.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Court is in trial on another matter and unable to hear case. Case is being spun to Judge Davila Br 01. Parties notified to appear via zoom.
Email correspondence with parties. Court is in trial on another matter and unable to hear case. Case re-scheduled for Competency Hearing on 07/26/2022 at 09:30 am, Br 29.

Attorney Andrew Joel Golden in court, defendant Kayla Marvella Avery not in court, in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a return on doctor's report.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Parties review the report. Defense contests the report and requests a competency hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Competency hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Andrew Joel Golden in court, defendant Kayla Marvella Avery not in court, in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a return on doctor's report. Defense counsel needs to review the report with his client and requests an adjournment.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
filed.
signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Kayla Marvella Avery not in court, in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a bail/bond hearing.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.  Court temporarily stays the proceedings. Court vacates the preliminary hearing.   Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing may be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Armonie L.L.; J. Yang, except in his official capacity as a police officer
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

ADDRESS INFO for Kayla Marvella Avery
Current: 731 North 25th Street, #304, Mailing:  1220 W Vliet St., Milwaukee, WI 53205, Milwaukee, WI 53233   (Effective: 05-13-2022)
Prior: 731 North 25th Street, #304, Milwaukee, WI 53233

Defendant Kayla Marvella Avery in court with attorney John Daniel Flynn.  Defendant Kayla Marvella Avery in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kayla Marvella Avery appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 3, 4 and 5.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense request to be heard on bail.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da

Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE for Branch 29.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
